programme.title: SportsCenter with Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: Host Scott Van Pelt covers all of the important stories of the day, including game highlights, player interviews, and special segments; correspondents relay up-to-the-minute news and game-day reports from major sporting events.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: NC State (10-15, 3-11) seeks its first win away from home this season, starting 0-9; North Carolina (15-11, 8-6) beat the Wolfpack, 63-61, on Jan. 11 behind 21 points from Ian Jackson for its seventh win in the last nine meetings.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Arkansas (15-10, 4-8) comes off a 69-61 loss to Texas A&M on Feb. 15; No. 1 Auburn (23-2, 11-1) is 10-1 at home, and is top five in the country in scoring, averaging 85.1 ppg behind Johni Broome, who is the only SEC playing averaging a double-double.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon, longtime colleagues and friends, engage in verbal sparring during a fast-paced and wide-ranging discussion about current events in the world of sports; Kornheiser and Wilbon also interview special guests.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: Malika Andrews covers the latest news from around the NBA, breaking down the stories making headlines across the league, highlights and takeaways from recent games, and guest interviews to get a unique perspective on the league.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: A panel of reporters from across the country debate trending topics and stories in sports with points being awarded for valid arguments, and at the end of the show, the winner is awarded 30 uninterrupted seconds to discuss any topic of their choice.

programme.title: ESPN First Take
programme.desc: Molly Qerim is the moderator while veteran commentators Stephen A. Smith and Max Kellerman discuss and deliberate the latest topics in the world of sports; the debate show also features guest appearances by entertainers, athletes and journalists.

programme.title: The Mina Kimes Show featuring Lenny
programme.desc: Mina Kimes brings her vast NFL knowledge and unique insight to the top stories making headlines across the league, breaking down the impact of the news, and is joined by guests to gather a different perspective on all things football.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Tony Ferguson (25-3) enters the main event at UFC 249 on a 12-match winning streak as he goes up against Justin Gaethje (21-2), who won three straight since losses to Dustin Poirier and Eddie Alvarez, for the interim UFC Lightweight Championship.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Gonzaga (20-7, 11-3) won four-straight games, and beat the Cougars, 88-75, on Jan. 11 behind 21 points from Graham Ike, who is fourth in the WCC in scoring with 16.7 ppg; Washington State (16-11, 6-8) is 9-2 at home behind Nate Calmese.

programme.title: ESPN BET Live
programme.desc: Host and sports oddsmakers break down the latest betting action around sports, discussing some of the most recent lines on the marquee matchups and the upsets that bettors should be aware of before putting their money down on the game.

programme.title: Unsportsmanlike with Evan, Canty and Michelle
programme.desc: Evan Cohen, Chris Canty and Michelle Smallmon discuss the latest stories from around the world of sports making headlines, previewing some of the biggest games in the coming days, and guest interviews to gather their unique perspective.

programme.title: Good Guy/Bad Guy
programme.desc: UFC heavyweight and light heavyweight champion Daniel Cormier and UFC Hall of Fame member Chael Sonnen break down the latest from around the MMA world, recapping recent marquee events, the latest injury updates and guest interviews.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Cincinnati (15-10, 5-9) had its three-win streak snapped by Iowa State, 81-70; West Virginia (15-10, 6-8) is 10-4 at home, and beat the Bearcats, 63-50, on Feb. 2 behind 19 points from Javon Small, who leads Big 12 scoring with 18.6 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball Live
programme.desc: Game commentators provide a detailed look at all things pertaining to college basketball, including previews of upcoming games, analysis of game-changing moments, discussions on breaking news, highlights of top players and more.

programme.title: UFC Main Event
programme.desc: Dominick Cruz (22-2, 7 KO's) has beaten his last 12 opponents, and defeated Faber by unanimous decision in their last meeting at UFC 132, on Jul. 2, 2011; Uriah Faber (33-8, 7 KO's) is coming off a win over Frankie Saenz at UFC 194 on Dec. 12, 2015.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Wichita State (15-10, 5-7) won its last four games after an 84-79 overtime upset of then-No. 14 Memphis; Florida Atlantic (15-10, 8-4) won five-straight games, and won both meetings with the Shockers last season, including an 86-77 home win.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Louisville claimed a 61-44 victory over Duke in their lone meeting from the 2023-24 season on Jan. 4, 2024, behind Kiki Jefferson's 15 points and 4 rebounds; Oluchi Okananwa posted 14 points and 5 rebounds for the Blue Devils in the home loss.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Loyola Marymount (15-12, 7-8) dropped four of its last five games, but beat the Broncos, 57-54, on Jan. 16 behind 19 points from Caleb Stone-Carrawell; Santa Clara (17-10, 9-5) is 10-3 at home behind Adama-Alpha Bal, who leads the team with 13.7 ppg.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: Analysts preview the Fight Night 252 card and the bantamweight main event as Henry Cejudo (16-4-0) goes up against Song Yadong (21-8-1); other bouts include: Brendan Allen (24-6) faces Anthony Hernandez (13-2) in a middleweight bout.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: The Lakers and Celtics met in the NBA Finals for the first time in 1959, and in the 1960s the two franchises battled for the title six times; Bill Russell was a dominant figure for the Celtics, and Los Angeles featured Jerry West and Elgin Baylor.

programme.title: The Domonique Foxworth Show
programme.desc: Former NFL cornerback Domonique Foxworth shares his thoughts on the latest news making headlines from the sport he played, along with reactions to latest around the world of sports and guest interviews to gain a unique perspective.

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: In 1978, the Celtics drafted Larry Bird, but he played his final year at Indiana State before signing; Los Angeles selected Magic Johnson No. 1 in 1979 after he led Michigan State to a victory over Bird and the Sycamores in the NCAA title game.

programme.desc: Coverage of college basketball games.

programme.title: Women's College Gymnastics
programme.desc: Florida outplaced Oklahoma in their last meeting at Apr.'s 2024 NCAA Semifinals where the Gators advanced to the Championship in second; Florida posted a score of 197.875 while the Sooners posted a 196.5875 to finish third from the No. 1 seed.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: The top collegiate pom dancing squads from across the country compete for the UDA national title, showcasing their skills and choreography to a panel of judges at the annual event who grade their performances under certain criteria.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston OutDoors
programme.desc: Jimmy Houston is joined by his son Jamie on a fishing expedition to Oklahoma in hopes of reeling in trophy-caliber bass using creature baits, discussing the equipment he is using out on the water and his techniques for finding success.

programme.title: E:60
programme.desc: An in-depth newsmagazine featuring a talented pool of reporters and producers from ESPN, presenting profiles of well-known athletes and coaches as well as investigative reports and cutting-edge stories on emerging and established sports.

programme.title: Cheerleading & Dance Competitions
programme.desc: Performances are judged based on the difficulty of the routine, the demonstration of excellent precision and form in their technique, use of new, unique and innovative choreography in transitions and the overall creativity throughout the routine.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Providence (12-14, 6-9) ended a four-game skid with a 75-62 win over Villanova, and won its last eight meetings with the Hoyas after a 78-68 win on Jan. 25 behind Jayden Pierre and Bensley Joseph; Georgetown (15-10, 6-8) is 12-4 at home this season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Northwestern (13-13, 4-11) is 0-8 on the road despite Nick Martinelli, who leads Big Ten scoring with 19.8 ppg, but won the last two meetings after an 83-58 win last season; Ohio State (15-11, 7-8) is 10-5 at home behind Bruce Thornton.

programme.desc: No. 10 St. John's (22-4, 13-2) won its last six meetings with the Blue Demons after an 89-61 win on Dec. 17 behind 19 points from RJ Luis Jr., who is fourth in Big East scoring with 17.6 ppg; DePaul (11-14, 2-12) is 10-6 at home this season.

programme.title: NASCAR Craftsman Truck Series
programme.desc: Corey Heim opened the 2025 season with a victory at Daytona to gain an early three-point lead over defending champion Ty Majeski; Kyle Busch averaged 111.425 mph en route to his win at Atlanta last year, beating Majeski by 0.187 seconds.

programme.title: Bassmaster Elite Series
programme.desc: The highest level of professional bass fishing features pro anglers competing all season for the opportunity to win points toward the Progressive Bassmaster Angler of the Year award and to qualify for the Bassmaster Classic.

programme.desc: Los Angeles FC, a two-time runner-up, has won three of the past four meetings with Colorado Rapids across all competitions, including a 4-0 triumph at home in the semifinals of the 2024 Leagues Cup, as Ryan Hollingshead had two assists.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: FC Cincinnati advanced to the Round of 16 in last year's edition before falling to Monterrey on aggregate, 3-1, while Honduran side Motagua is unbeaten in 12 of its last 14 contests across all competitions; inaugural meeting between the two sides.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Inter Miami CF has won each of the two all-time meetings with Sporting Kansas City, including a 3-2 victory at Arrowhead Stadium in an MLS contest on April 13, as Luis Surez scored the match-winner off an assist from Diego Gmez in the 71st minute.

programme.title: PBA Bowling
programme.desc: The winner in the semifinal matchup between E J Tackett and Timmy Tan, as well as the victor between Tim Foy Jr. and Dom Barrett advance to compete for the top prize of $30,000; Anthony Simonsen of Las Vegas took home the title in 2024.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Seattle Sounders FC became the third American club to win the tournament after hoisting the crown in the 2022 edition; Guatemalan side Antigua GFC, which returns to the competition for the first time since 2016, is 0-2-2 all-time in the tournament.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Vancouver Whitecaps FC is just 1-1-6 over its last eight Concacaf Champions League matches after suffering a 3-0 setback to Tigres UANL on Feb. 14, 2024; Costa Rican side Deportivo Saprissa has won the tournament three times (1993, 1995, 2005).

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Ahli claimed a 4-2 victory over Damac in their first meeting of the season on Sept. 20, led by a brace and assist from forward Ivan Toney; midfielder Gabri Veiga posted a goal and a pair of assists for Al-Ahli in the win at home.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: William Byron secured his first win in "The Great American Race" last year, narrowly edging out Alex Bowman after the race went under caution; Joey Logano won four races last season en route to winning his third Cup Series championship.

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Nassr claimed a 3-0 victory over Al-Ettifaq in their first meeting of the season on Sept. 20, led by a pair of assists from Sadio Man in the second half; Cristiano Ronaldo, Salem Alnajdi and Anderson Talisca found the net for Al-Nassr in the win.

programme.title: 2025 CONCACAF Women's U-20 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Bermuda U20 won its last CONCACAF U20 qualifier after defeating Anguilla U20, 3-1, on April 18, 2023; Trinidad & Tobago U20 seeks its best finish in the tournament since earning a fourth-place finish in the 2014 edition held in the Cayman Islands.
